comment.text:
Authentic and consistent. The Classic taco is hard to put into words despite the fact that it is exactly what it claims to be. It's just perfect and I could eat them every day. 
The other tacos are amazing as well. They are made with fresh ingredients and you can taste the difference.

I am not going to make this too complicated as it's very cut and dry. These are the best tacos in Atlanta and it's not even close to me. The El Pastor and the Steak tacos are perfection. The flavors are explosive and balanced at the same time. It is so savory and the house made hot sauce is some of the best I have ever had as well. They sell it by the bottle and you are a fool if you don't take one home with you. You have to eat here. Even if you don't live close by you have to drive here to try it. Order the pork and steak and it will change your life. I promise. The service is wonderful as well. They are so kind and quick to do anything they can to make your experience the best.
Everything on their menu is absolutely delicious! I went there for some tacos and it blew my mind how good they are. If you're around here you should definitely try it out!

If I could give this place zero stars... I WOULD! The taco pictured was $4!! You're better off going to a chain restaurant like Del Taco over this spot... or hell even just getting some actual authentic tacos from Taco La Villa... authentic tacos don't cost $4/taco AND come fully dressed, NOT drizzled in this green sauce w/a lil sprinkle of cheese! Pls do better!

owner_replies.comment: I am sorry you had a bad experience. We work really hard to provide fresh authentic food and again I am sorry we did not meet expectations. If you come back, and I hope you will, please ask for Jason and lets see if we cant win your tastebuds and your business back. Hope you and your family are safe and healthy.

comment.text:
Only people eating in here are non - Hispanics which should have indicated the food may not be that yummy/ authentic. Tacos had 0 flavor and very dry. The only hot sauce they had was house made which also lacked salt/ flavor. Super disappointed and barely even wanted to eat the food.

You may find my comment on the ethnicity of the clients entertaining but that doesn't change that your food lacks flavor. Sorry you can't take feedback and in turn laughed

owner_replies.comment:
“Only people eating in here are non-Hispanics which should have indicated the food may not be that yummy/authentic”..........
Congrats you win the grand prize for the MOST STUPID comment of all time!!!!!!    I read this to my staff and we were laughing so hard we were in tears.  Thank you for the comic relief.
I cant resist, according to your comments/logic,  if one should venture out to a chinese restaurant and the only people eating there are non chinese one should leave? If going to an Italian restaurant and the place is not filled with Italians one should leave.... Just out of curiosity who/whom should we look for when we go to Waffle House or McDonalds???   Dying to know.  Perhaps you could post a guide for all of to keep handy and refer to.  “How to racially profile a restaurant”..... a morons guide to eating out

On the contrary we find your ethnicity comments disgusting.

comment.text: The churros are fantastic!  The brisket taco is good but that pork belly taco gave me life!

owner_replies.comment: Thank you. Hope see you again soon.

comment.text: BEST BIRRIA TACOS IVE EVER HAD. Margaritas are also really good, good service. I make sure to come here whenever I am in west midtown!

Ok so I've heard and read so much about tjis place. I had to come and check it out dor myself. So its in a great location, right off of Howell Mill Rd. The only problem is the front parking lot can only fit about 3 cars, put there is plenty of parking in the back. So when I walked in I was able to order immediately. The lady at the counter suggested the fish taco and the pork belly taco. So thats what I ordered along with the guacamole.  The guacamole was delicious. The Big Fish taco was very meaty and very filling. However it had no flavor at all
 I did speak with the staff about it. He apologized for that. The pork belly taco was also very good. I will try this spot again because its not far from home.

photos.caption: Pork Belly taco and Big Fish taco.

comment.text:
Don't waste your time or money, spare your mouth and don't support a disrespectful store owner. 

Decided to try a new taco place as opposed to the 5 other favorites we regular. Wouldn't return. First, the price is a bit steep, especially considering it's store bought tortillas and cheap quality meat. 

Our tacos came, pork belly was good, fish taco was fine. Steak taco I thought was an accidental ground beef, but no, it was steak, but it was quite gristly, and not seasoned well. Same goes for the chicken taco. As for the queso (if you can call it that), it tasted like a version of kraft Mac n cheese. Chips were fine. Nothing to write home about. 

Initially I was going to rate this a 2/5, then I started reading how "business owner Jason" responds to negative reviews. We'll never go again. Honestly it's sad how a business owner is openly berating customers public ally is just inexcusable. I understand, customers can be wrong, but if the way you treat customers is so rude, I feel terrible for your workers. I've worked at plenty of restaurants and seen plenty of bad reviews, and any time, the owner would be kind, invite the customer to a free meal on the house to discuss how they might see it better.

Now I guess I'll wait patiently to get berated by Jason.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for your kind words and spirited endorsement

comment.text:
Based on the ratings I had high hopes. Maybe we were there when the team was having an off night. Our experience: Poor service and bland tacos and salsa.
Came in and the cashier seemed more interested in what was on TV than taking our order. There was an assistant or food expediter (brought food from the kitchen to the table) and her attitude was terrible. We asked about what was on a taco we ordered and she said it was whatever is on the menu and if we wanted something different we should have asked. Unnecessary poor attitude and customer service.
The tacos were close to flavorless even with chimichurri, and tasted bland.
We also had salsa which would be classified as pico de gallo. Mostly heavy lime and salt and not remarkable.
The decor of the restaurant was pretty cool.
The service was poor.
This was both a waste of our time and money.

Wow...I want to call this an unknown gem but I bragged to lots of folks about it and they already knew about it . BUT if you're going here...GET THE BIG FISH TACO. It's the best taco I've had in a while. I do not know how they get the fix to fry so perfectly and so round and delicious but they do it FANTASTICALLY. The guac was FRESH and vibrant as well. We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Big fish and chicken taco with guac and salsa

comment.text:
*food*
I got the classic taco. DELICIOUS. Ground beef is both juicy and flavorful. 

*allergy* 
Now, if you have a shellfish allergy (as I do) - I spoke to them about this. From what I understood/how it was explained to me, the grill is primarily used for steak and shrimp, the shrimp being on one side only. The spatula, may or may not be used to handle both. Everything else, ground beef,  etc. seems to be prepared elsewhere. Be sure to let the staff know of your allergy when you order. They were very, very accommodating about this, and they will be able to better give you an idea for your safety. That being sad, I would feel more comfortable if they had a standard allergy protocol, where they have separate utensils and grills, but that is asking for a lot of accommodation, esp for a small restaurant so I do understand that. Just something to mention. Overall they will be very accommodating to you, and it made me feel very taken care of.

*margaritas*
OKAY LETS TALK ABOUT THIS - all the hardship you have faced in 2020 - is about to be cleansed. They filled the cups up so much they overflowed. And you got STRONG tequila with every sip. They know what you've been through and they've got you. 

*corona safety* 
They do pick up / walk up behind the building, so drive around back.they have masks and all that is required to feel safely served

Based on the pics and reviews, I thought this place would be a winner. Especially since it's in my neighborhood too but it's a hard pass for me. I mean the service is great. They greet you as you walk in and the staff discards your tray and dishes for you so you don't have to worry about it. Unfortunately, Parking can be a pain if the main lot behind the building is filled up. On the other hand, there's street parking and parking on the lawn but I ended up parking across the street at Fabricate Studios and my car was fine. Now the food...Sigh. Nothing special about it at all. I ordered the Mexican bowl which you basically choose any of the tacos on the menu and it'll come in a bowl version. I ordered the vegetarian one and added black beans. I thought I'd be getting it in a taco shell or something since I was only ordering the bowl version but no. There wasn't anything Mexican about it. It was a small size bowl of the beans, guacamole and tomatoes. And apparently if you want rice, you'll have to ask for it which I didn't understand because the taco itself comes with rice. 

And the cilantro/jalapeño margarita? Way salty. No bueno. Its a nice size place and they have live music - giving off a coffee shop vibe. And it stays busy. I mean the lines were pretty long at several points of the evening. Maybe their other tacos are better.

photos.caption: Cilantro Jalapeño Margarita with the "Mexican bowl"

comment.text:
I must say, I came here when they first opened and they were amazing. The tacos, the nachos, and especially the margaritas were the best.

Today's visit, not so much. The margaritas quality isn't as good. The meat was really grizzly. The corn tortillas were store bought, the toppings on the tacos did not add anything to the taco. We then decided to get chips and salsa with some of their jalapeño cheese rice. I was thinking, that's simple, no way it could be bad. They brought out pico de Gallo, not salsa. The cheese rice tasted like uncle Ben's instant rice, with a spoon of queso on top, and fresh jalapeños as garnish. 

To be honest, I was disappointed because I was looking forward to having this again.

owner_replies.comment: Sorry for your bad experience. We have changed little since our opening. You are correct that as a consequence of Covid we stopped making our Corn tortillas by hand and discontinued nachos as they did not do well in the covid necessary packaging.  Nothing else has changed since say one and we have never served anything but our fresh pico de gallo. Again sorry you did not enjoy your meal.

comment.text: Yo the food here is great and I leave drunk everytime lmfao ! I use to drive past this place all the time and a never thought to check it out till recently and let me say i'm inlove! i was looking for a good mexican spot and saw this place was highly rated & to my surprise  when I first tried it I actually ended up coming back 2 days in a row!! i'm really inlove with the fried shrimp tacos. and if you have to choose between steak or shrimp do steak! thank me later  I wish I was able to post pics but everything is so good including the venue feel I didn't get to capture the moment

Margarita are amazing
Guacamole is amazing 
Service was amazing 

My new go to for Mexican food

Favorite taco spot so far in Atlanta. Tacos are always fresh and tasty, the pork belly is my favorite. They need to put fried shrimp taco on the menu permanently!!! Omg it was so good when I tried as a special. Love this place, good tacos, good customer service.

I Ordered the fish and shrimp taco. It was tasty, but the fish lacked seasoning. It was bland, but hot so I added their amazing pico(which they advertise as salsa) onto it and gave it some flavor. The shrimp tacos were good. The only downside is I wished they had traditional "taco shop" salsa that's puréed. The guys that took my order were very pleasant and the inside dining area was very clean.

photos.caption: Fried fish and Grilled shrimp taco

comment.text:
We got a pitcher of margaritas and all of the tequila was at the top, so we had to stir it ourselves with plastic utensils. The house margaritas were ok, not great. We got chicken quesadillas, filled with dark chicken meat and low quality cheddar cheese. The sour cream side portion was more like a runny liquid the size of a tiny rain drop. For $8, you're better off going to Moe's where the quality and portion sizes are greater. 

This place is a good location off of Howell Mill with a parking lot- but why is there a fence behind the parking spots? It is tight and hard to back up. Easy to get seats for a large group. It's order at the counter and seat yourself. There's not any signage to explain this process. 

I was excited about this place, but I was pretty disappointed. Very overpriced.

owner_replies.comment: We are happy there are several Moe’s locations for you to enjoy.   We do not use sour cream rather a light house made crema.  The chicken is local all natural chicken thighs as we find this to be most flavorful.  We do not use low quality cheddar cheese.   I would discuss where we source our foods from but it would be lost on your culinary expertise. Again, enjoy Moe’s and please before you write nonsensical and wrong things please remember that there are people who work very hard here and everywhere else and your ridiculous comments put their jobs and lives in jeopardy. Your opinion is yours and always welcome but please refrain from making specific comments about things you obviously know little about.  We should have made sure your pitcher of margaritas was stirred and mixed prior to arriving to you and I will address this with our staff.

comment.text:
Oh, Yelpers, how you led me astray.  I foolishly believed the reviews of Tuza and jumped in feet first.  I was so betrayed!  

Tuza is set up like Taquria del Sol where you order at the counter and they bring your food to you.  The menu is basic which I'm a fan of. I ordered queso, 2 chicken tacos and a mezcal margarita.  The mezcal margarita tasted good, but it was so small (highball glass.)  And I didn't want to go thru the hassle of getting back in line to order another one because Tuza stayed busy the entire time we were there on a Tuesday night.  

The queso was bland and I didn't finish it.  The chips were ordinary, nothing special.  The chicken tacos were so flavorless that I wanted to sob.  I hate when my whole meal is a downer, and this one was downright depressing.  My friend had a carne taco and chicken taco and she said the carne taco was marginally better than the chicken.  

Maybe everyone's enamored of Tuza because it has some parking? I don't know.  Or maybe I caught them on a bad night.  Whatever it was, I'm not going back for more.

Tasty. Simple. Fresh! The tacos at Tuza are straightforward and delicious. We tried a majority of the tacos: Big fish, Steak, shrimp, Chicken, Pork Belly and Carnitas!  And that is the order I liked them from fav to least fav. They were all pretty good but The crispiness of big fish and the steak taco's zesty chimichurri style sauce make these two the clear winners for me! The best part about these tacos is that they are made on delicious corn tortillas that are not grainy and can hold up to all the protein, toppings and sauces without falling apart. 

The classic margaritas are delish, their sour mix is made in house so they taste really fresh and citrusy not overly sugared/syrupy. We also got queso which is standard/ good but made better with adding a few dabs of their signature hot sauce that's preset on each table. There's a good amount of indoor seating and bar seating is available. There is an outdoor patio too. The staff was attentive and the food came out quicker than expected. Overall great experience!

This place is really good. It's unusual to get delicious, fresh tacos without heading up to Buford Highway, but Tuza pulls it off.  I ordered chips and salsa to start.  The salsa was super fresh and tasty.  I had three tacos, a shrimp taco, a carnita taco, and the classic taco.  The shrimp and carnita were both really good, but the classic taco was the most interesting.  It's a hard taco shell with ground beef, lettuce and cheese, just like you probably had at a school cafeteria growing up, but so much better.  I'd go back just to order several of those.  

You order at the counter and the food comes out quickly.  They also have a full bar if you would like a drink as well as indoor and outdoor seating.  Parking is in the back and is easy.  There is a door in the back of the building near where you park that leads to a staircase up to the restaurant.

I enjoyed it and will go back.  Definitely recommend you give it a try.

Finally a place in the perimeter that has authentic tacos. They make the tortillas in house and hand press them to order.

My favorite tacos are the big fish and steak tacos. The big fish tacos were really flaky and have a nice bite. And don't forget the queso, guac & salsa! They also recently added elotes to the menu (on the cob), which had good flavor. 

The biggest selling point of this place is the tortillas. And they are gluten free.

I also just love the whole vibe / color scheme of the place. They have some outdoor seating, which is a nice option as well. Plenty of seating to fit a large party too.

photos.caption: Big Fish in the front / Steak in the back

comment.text:
Great tacos! 

Strong Margs! 

Easy atmosphere! 

Highly recommend! 

We had the fish, steak, chicken and veggie tacos. All were great!

owner_replies.comment: Thank you hope see you again soon.

comment.text:
So delicious!  Just had a great lunch at Tuza.  The staff was very friendly, the food was fresh and delicious!  I thought the decor was really cute and would love to sip margaritas outside on the cute patio on a cooler day.  

I had a steak taco and a fried fish taco, both were great, but the fish was awesome!  

I could eat lunch here every day.  Yummmm...
Super cool spot - parking in the back! Fast, fast service with excellent tacos and did someone say jalapeño infused margaritas FTW!

photos.caption: Great, fast service with jalapeño infused margaritas!!

comment.text:
honestly, the BEST tacos i've had on the east coast!  everything was delightfully fresh, made to order, and tasted brilliant. 

my husband and i ordered the big fish, carnitas, steak and shrimp - they were delicious. the carnitas was crispy and crunchy. the steak was juicy and bright. the shrimp was light and bright. and the big fish was just that! BIG! the beer battered piece was as large as tall as the taco shell when wrapped up. the batter was crunchy, yet light. we enjoyed them all, but definitely loved the fish most. 

3 tacos each plus queso and chips were definitely enough for lunch. initially i ordered 2 thinking i'd be a dainty lady, but my stomach got the better of me and i had Jas go back up to the front and order another big fish for me. plus the tortillas are amazing! 

i saw people weren't loving the $4 price tag, but considering how fresh everything was, it's definitely worth it! this will be our new go-to for tacos from here on out. 

the interior is charming with bright colors, patterned floors and glass counters so you can watch everything being made. 

they offer a full bar and next time i'm snagging a margarita and hubby can be the DD. and their patio, while small, is charming. i like how they chose to "block" out some of the main drag noises with the wooden fence. it made the patio space feel more intimate and personal. 

the staff was excellent and incredibly kind. they were also very conscious not to serve anything over our baby in the carrier beneath the edge of the table - that won major brownie points from me. no complaints what so ever. 

Tuza is located along busy howell mill road, but it is brightly colored and easy to spot. parking in the front is challenging as there are only a few spots, but never fear, there's ample room in the back. if you do park behind, you can use the back entrance and head up the stairs to find begin your delicious journey. 

if you're wondering if you should try this place, YES! you should. climb in the car immediately and head over for great food in a welcoming atmosphere.

photos.caption: initial round of our taco trials. from top left to right: 1 carnitas looking pretty with crispy tips, 1 steak being limed, & 2 big fish!
close up of the big fish taco in the wild - once dripped with lime, its ready for eating
close up of the carnitas crispy pieces. just look at those onions and cilantro additions!
love the eclectic tile bar - you can watch as tortillas are made and delicious is created
overhead of the shrimp taco - it might not look like much, but the flavor POPS! we tried the hot sauce with this one - yum!
up close of steak taco - don't you just want to dive into that gorgeous thing?! the meat was juicy and tender
when you first walk in the amazing smells hit you. if you need a seat, there are little benches right in front

comment.text:
Overall it's on my watch list, they got some things right but need to work on some others. 

Pros: pork belly tacos are on point! Handmade tortillas are excellent. Strong margs as well!

Cons: ditch the bagged chips and use your handmade tortillas (cut and fried into nachos). Not sure how but the queso needs work, and less sweetness on the carnitas (balance the salt and sweet or ditch the sugar altogether) 

I love local shops and would enjoy this place again, hopefully this helps.

photos.caption: Pork belly tacos and carnitas with pickled onions

comment.text:
Excellent little taco place!  I've wanted to come here for a while, and  I wasn't disappointed.

The food is fresh - corn tortillas made right in front of you.  Tuva is small and quaint with a bar!  I didn't try the margaritas this time, but I definitely will when I come back.

We ordered an assortment of tacos (chicken, brisket, and shrimp) and all were delicious.  I also tried the jalapeno cheese rice.  It was a little cheesier than expected, but perfect with chips.  

The staff is very friendly and accommodating. I have a gluten sensitivity and everything here is gluten free (corn tortillas only). 

I tried to get more pictures, but everyone was already digging in.

Just love this place so much! Friendly staff and amazing food. If you're getting take out, it's faster than Chic-Fil-A, and it's REAL good food. Big Fish Taco is not to miss and if they have Lengua, get it before it's gone!

Very clean, fast service, servers cleaning constantly and wearing masks! Food was pretty good, added hot sauce and was perfect. Chips were fresh and perfectly salted, outdoor seating created the perfect ambience to enjoy the appropriately priced menu. Would eat again!

The new Atlanta street taco kings. Tacos have authentic and fresh flavors, but are assembled with an elevated style.

The corn tortillas may be the best I've ever had. Made to order fresh, right in front of you. The salsa and hot sauce are house made and taste amazing.

The staff were personable and on top of it. Our food came out quickly. My new spot on the Westside.

photos.caption: Front to back. Pork belly, bisteca, and fish tacos

comment.text:
Tuza Taco is definitely going to be a new favorite in the upper Westside area. The location is easy to access and there's plenty of parking around back. The tacos are better than any I've had in Atlanta. Tortillas are made fresh in front of you, steak is grilled and sliced fresh for each taco, and the vegetables are all fresh. 
The owners are friendly and highly involved, and told us about plans for a dog-friendly patio, an afternoon happy hour tapas menu, and live music at the bar in the evening. 
My favorites so far are the steak taco, carnitas taco and fish taco
Dayum that cod taco was incredible!! Holy smokes. Did not expect that. Can't wait to come back

Awesome taco place that I visit at least once a week. All their ingredients are super fresh and their guacamole is unmatched. I definitely recommend trying the big fish taco! Plus, the margaritas are so yummy and they serve Topo Chico too!

This new spot totally exceeded our expectations.   We heard great things about it when it first opened, and it definitely lives up to the hype. The hand-made tortillas are better than some I've had in Mexico. The real star is the carnitas tacos. They are amazing! They have a hint of sweetness, which balances well with lime squeezed on top. The prices are very reasonable, and the decor is great. Kids will enjoy all of the selections, not just what's on the kids menu. 

This is a great addition to this area. The owner is super nice, too, so go check it out, and frequent it often!

Got the birria Taco. A little pricey just for two tacos and a minuture cup of consommé , $10. I really like birria and wanted to try it out. I took one bite and gagged, something was not done right in the process of making this batch. There was a weird smell and taste from whatever they dipped it in that just made the tacos inedible.Their tacos in general are okay. But for $5 a taco average, I've had better and least expensive! Probably won't be back based on those facts.

owner_replies.comment: I wish you would have told us. We sell lots and would have immediately either changed for you or made a new order.  I checked the Birria process and all normal here. Sorry you did not enjoy. Please consider returning and giving Tuza another try.

comment.text:
Don't waste your time!!   Customer service is the worst!!!   Owner not offering third party delivery service, Just FYI!!   Definitely NOT returning and if you want better tacos, better service go to RReal Tacos in Midtown or Velvet Tacos in Buckhead, you'll thank me!!!  I'm not mad about them not offering delivery, I'm Appalled the way the owner handled the call and situation.

I'm sure I'll get a GREAT response from the business owner Jason just like others have.  I can't wait to hear the mumble jumble he has to say.   Don't support a business that obviously doesn't support you as a community and definitely doesn't value you as a customer!!!...

Jason; your mumbo-jumbo as a poor excuse and elementary level of a conversation is complete idiotic. commenting to those who actually speak up and recognize your fake ways, who do not appreciate nor value your establishment or your managing skills is beyond ridiculous! Trust and believe you may think you are a success but soon you'll see that you're a complete failure, so I hope you have a back up plan because this location will not last!.. people don't like fake, rude and especially someone who doesn't appreciate their customer base.  So enjoy your self applied success while it last the 2.5sec's before your true colors ruin it all!!..

owner_replies.comment: After a year and a half as a restaurant owner I have had some  interesting phone calls from customers. I can remember on ONLY 2 occasions when I hung up the phone and said to someone next to me, “ you would not believe the moron that I just had on the phone”...  I remember having to listen to your rude inquiry about my decision to not use 3rd party delivery. YOU WERE ONE OF THE TWO CALLS..I am pleased that you will not be returning to our restaurant. It is a good thing that 3rd party delivery exists as it will save other staff and owners from NOT having to deal with your OBNOXIOUS unkind demeanor face to face. I hope you are safe and healthy during these difficult times and please NEVER call or come back.  I feel sorry for RReal Tacos and Velvet Taco. They are nice people doing great work and hate to think they have to deal with you often.  The ONLY reason Tuza is successful before and now during these most difficult times is MY Insistence on supporting our community and our customers you moron.  Hoping this is read by ALL of Atlanta and further hoping it is enough mumble jumble.

comment.text: I decided to try this restaurant after reading the reviews and yes, their fish tacos are pretty good and I will be coming back soon for the fish tacos.  I also tried the shrimp, chicken and steak taco as well.  The shrimp & steak tacos are ok but nothing special.  My downfall was the chicken taco, it was not seasoned to the taste and the chicken didn't seem to be cooked thoroughly so after one bite I had to trash it.  The chicken tasted very bland and not grilled at all and absolutely no seasoning.  Other than the bland uncooked chicken I will come back for the fish taco for sure.

I wasn't sure about this place as we pulled in, it looked like someone was selling food from their garage. That's just where you place your order and get your drinks. Once you've ordered  you just tell them if you're going to sit inside or outside. We choose inside because it was a little cold outside. Once inside we were greeted and given complementary bottles of water and napkins. Our food was brought to us within 5 to 10 minutes & it was wonderful! We each got 3 tacos. I got Carnitas, Chicken, and Shrimp, they were all good but the Carnitas was my favorite. My husband got Carnitas, Pork belly, and Carne asada. They were so good that my husband went & got us each 3 more. This time he got me the: Pork belly, Classic crunchy taco, and another Carnitas. I was so focused on my tacos that I don't remember what his second round was lol. The only negative thing was we ordered the regular size guacamole, and paid $7 for a small little container that should be more like $3 to $3.50. However, it did taste good. If you like authentic tacos, you have to try this place.
Just had the big fish tacos, awesome. These guys are doing a great job with the outside seating options. Reasonably priced margarita in a good sized to go cup. Will be back soon.

Absolutely loved my experience at Tuza! The Barbacoa tacos were the best I've had in Atlanta hands down. If you see those bad boys of deliciousness on the menu, do yourself a favor and buy a couple... or 5.

Located about 1.5 miles from my apartment, I frequently stop in on my way to Monday Night Brewery. This is a great spot to hang with your friends or have a picnic-ky little date night with your significant other. My favorite Taco spot in Atlanta and my favorite locally owned business to turn my friends on to. 

Keep up the great work, team! Also, the owner is a complete savage in some of his review responses. This only adds to my love for the Tuza team.

The owner and staff are very kind + attentive. The tacos are amazing + a great portion! The big fish taco + cheese rice are must try's! Moved to Atlanta a few months ago and this has quickly become my favorite neighborhood taco spot. Brought my mom here for her birthday close to closing time and we received remarkable service!
Great atmosphere, covid friendly, food was fantastic, and the freshness of the salsa AMAZING. Did I mention that superb service?

I used to be within walking distance of this place and it was dangerous. Tacos, burritos, and the margs in the styrofoam cup. Carnitas is very good and the big fish isn't far behind. I've had to put a limit on how much I go.

Let me be clear, the big fish taco is EVERYTHING! Crispy, crunchy, light, flaky, never greasy fish topped with fresh, tangy slaw and chipotle Mayo. Optional homemade hot sauce in the squirt bottles is equally flavorful as it is spicy. I've had the other tacos and they are good but the big fish taco holds a special place in my heart. The service is excellent as well. I really enjoy coming here. 10 out of 10 would recommend.

photos.caption: Big Mahi Mahi Fish Taco - Toasted Flour Tortilla
Big Big Mahi Mahi Fish Taco - Toasted Flour Tortilla

comment.text:
Wonderful addition to the flowering restaurant scene in West Midtown. Tacos are delicious - I especially enjoy the shrimp, fish (cod), and carnitas tacos. My only gripe is that the tacos are smedium (four tacos provide for a satisfying meal)! The guacamole is made-to-order and is delicious as well. 

Margaritas are delicious and hit pretty well. 

I absolutely recommend Tuza, and I am a repeat customer who has always been very happy with my experience and the food.

Moved over to the Westside a few months ago and have had a number of people tell us to try Tuza. We finally got around to it and are glad that we did! 

Tuza is an unassuming little place that is very affordable for the quality of food. Everything was very good and the check was light!

You order with the cashier and then find a table. They have a good variety of beers and I've heard the margaritas are great as well, but I wasn't able to try. 

Come check this place out if you're looking for a fast casual place that serves some solid stuff!

Been wanting to come here for a while and finally did.  Wouldn't change a thing.  The guacamole was exactly the way we make it at home.  Tomatoes onion lime cilantro and the guacamole was fresh with just the right amount of chunks.

We had the steak, classic, shrimp, fish tacos.  All were exactly what you want when you're looking for straight forward home made tacos.  

The rice and beans add well.  

There's a very popular taqueria not far from here where people wait in line. I finally tried it a few months ago and wasn't impressed.

Will definitely come here when on the Westside.

Thanks for taking pride in you business Tuza!

Tuza Taco is basically a cheaper, more authentic version of BarTaco! The GUACAMOLE is some of the best I have ever had! Drinks were very affordable as well.

Food tasted so fresh, I tried the fish and pork belly tacos. I will definitely be going back, as this place is so close to home for me!
